Наверно лучшая игра своего жанра... а многие, прочитав это, начнут смеяться. А ведь по типичным таким причинам. 
Говорят, что в игре нет баланса. Это не точное утверждение. В игре с системой навыков, которые, к тому же, не уникальны, баланс есть всегда-всё зависит от вашего случая. 
Говорят, что игра баганная. Но давайте будем честны, в каждой игре есть баги, а в этой игре они не критичны, зачастую.
Говорят, что у неё трудный порог вхождения. Ну тут можно и согласиться. Когда играешь сам, конечно же, не легко. С командой друзей будет куда легче и интересней. А в этой игре очень влияет коммуникация с другими. 
В игре, как и везде, есть отсталые дебилы, которые кое-как смогли купить игру, хотя бы с 10 попытки. Мой вам совет: играйте в своё удовольствие, не обращайте внимание на таких дурачков и почаще проверяйте комментарии профиля. Там можно найти много интересных фактов о своей жизни, и о жизни своих друзей.

だいぶやりこんでみた。
このゲームのプレイヤー人口は
サバイバー赤ランク　多い
サバイバー紫ランク　非常に多い
サバイバー緑ランク　やや少ない
サバイバー黄色ランク　少ない
サバイバー白ランク　非常に少ない
キラー赤ランク　少ない
キラー紫ランク　少ない
キラー緑ランク　多い
キラー黄色ランク　多い
キラー白ランク　少ない
という感じになっている
赤は最高ランクで１から４、紫は５から８、みどりは９から１２、黄色は１３から１６、白は１７から２０となる。
ゲームバランスはサバイバーがかなり有利にできている。
その為サバイバーはランクが上がりやすくこのようなプレイヤー人口バランスになっており、サバイバーのランクの高い順とキラーのランクの高い順で当てていくのでプレイヤーバランスから緑、黄色のキラーは赤ランクサバイバーと当たりやすくなる。
ランク差のあるマッチングに面白さを感じないキラーは、マウス操作を自動化するなどして、定期的に次のマッチへ、準備完了を押すようなうごきをつくってひたすらマッチを開始してずーっと棒立ちしているプレイをすることによりランクを下げている。
人口バランスからラッシュ時はサバイバーは１マッチの待ち時間が１０分以上、それで当たったキラーが棒立ちしてうごかないのだからつまらないことこのうえない。
キラーがランクを上げやすい環境（キラーの強化）そして高ランクのサバイバーを相手にした時の報酬増（イリデスントシャード、ＢＰ）をしないとこの放置キラーとキラー不足によるサバイバーのマッチング待ち時間の長さは改善されないだろう。
今後、スキルレーティングというマッチングシステムの変更とランクを１月毎にリセットし、到達したランクでＢＰを報酬として与えるようだが、もらえる報酬は月決めで大して多くもなく、定期的にランクを下げたほうが報酬効率が上がって元が取れる状態であり、相手が各上だった場合、ランクが上がりやすく、下がりにくくなる通常のレーティングシステムではなく、相手の強さに関係なく、ゲーム内でどのくらい成果をだしたかでランクが上がるシステムなので無理にキラー側で各上と試合しながらランクを高くしようとする人はあまりでてこないだろう。

This game is what you put in to it.

The core gameplay loop is straightforward and very easy to understand. Survivors repair generators and attempt to escape. The killer attempts to stop them. That hasn't changed and doesn't change from one game to the next so it's almost hard to explain what keeps you playing. The procedural elements to the different maps play their part to make each game feel a bit different, though this shouldn't be overstated too much.

The combination of character perks, tools, add-ons and offerings which shake up the mechanics for both sides from one match to another are interesting to experiment with. For survivors in particular they are most effective when coordinating with a group - but most of the time you won't be doing that so it's best just to figure out what works best for you and how you want to play each match.

This is balanced out by a grindy process of unlocking items, add-ons and these character-specific perks with points acquired on a per-game basis. How much enjoyment you derive out of the basic loop will determine whether this is going to be worth your time at all. As a survivor, if you escape then you can keep your items. If you are sacrificed then you lose them. Thankfully I find the core gameplay a bit of a buzz whether playing a more stealthy killer like Michael Myres or Ghostface (albeit DLC for a couple quid - but long term players are going to be wanting to unlock them as that's really part of the experience) or playing a more active Survivor role of sabotaging hooks and generally trying to mess with and distract the killer instead of just trying to repair generators unseen. But I can see how many could be put off by this relatively quickly.

As it is, I'm enjoying going through various killers to level them up and unlock their unique perks for use with other characters. The Survivor side feels more one-note and I'm less inclined to go through the same process but I still enjoy the games so I won't rule it out over time.

Your mileage will definitely vary. But it's often on sale so I would recommend at least giving it a go.

I've had a chance to play it long ago on a free weekend and must admit the game has come a long way since then, still so fun. There are pros and cons however so let me lay those out for you if you want to know what you're getting into - got the game recently and was hooked.

Pros:
-You are in a horror movie scenario
-Unique mechanics for killers
-Unique mechanics from perks
-Decent balancing
-High skill cap
-Competitive
-Community seems decent, have only met 1 toxic player so far
-You have options to modify a lot of your items and powers, combined with perks offers a lot of different play styles
-Can modify your BP collection rates with some add-ons and perks
-Endgame survivors become simply skins, as you should have unlocked most their perks to be available for all

Cons:
-Strong perks locked behind paywall - making some elements P2W unless you are lucky and get the perk you need for your build in shrine of secrets or fork up the cash for the killer/survivor
-Not all characters unlockable through playing the game
-Playing with 3 other random survivors is - well random. You never know if you are getting people who know what they are doing or not
-Expanding on the above - people ragequit and DC when playing with randoms - great for you if you are not on the team that does it
-Rank system seems to be busted or not of much use - I have been paired with rank 1 and 2s both as killer v survivors and the opposite - doesn't really reflect skill levels as I had won in both scenarios even though my personal rank is mid-tier atm - around 12 in each category
-Unlocking teachable perks is a grind 
-lvl 1 to 50 is about 1,6 mill BP if you want to max a character
-Some killers are almost useless without modifications to their powers
-Said modifications are 1 per match use unless you use other modifications (also 1 per match) to keep them after match ends, which limits your build options if you don't sink in tons of the BP you make back into the killer you are playing to grab those modifications to powers
-BP gains are strictly related with skill level


Verdict and Summary:
Really fun game, would highly recommend it if you like the pros section
For survivor - best played with friends, as random teammates are a double-edged sword
Despite being grindy it's mostly fun to do the grind and I feel the BP rates are decent if you are also decent at filling out your objectives - I consistently get 20k + in my games regardless what side I play on and that's without modifiers to BP rates

Dead by Daylight,

ist ein Horror Koop Game wie man es mögen kann, leider finde ich die Balance nicht immer ausgeglichen, so dass der Killer weit mehr Vorteile hat als ein Überlebender. Wenn man online spielt kann es schon teilweise sehr frusten, wenn man ständig auf den Haken kommt, obwohl man vorsichtig ist. Daher macht es aber in einer privaten Gruppe umso mehr Spaß sich zu jagen. Leider bekommt man dort keine Blutpunkte. Aber im Ganzen bekommt es trotzdem einen Daumen hoch. Es ist an sich von der Art sehr gut gelungen und es kommen aktuell immer wieder neue DLCs, mal schauen, wo die Reise noch hin geht. Ich werde immer wieder gerne ein paar Runden spielen.
Jogo muito bom, super divertido para jogar com os amigos. Recomendo muito xD ❤️
